intro: Cischweinfia donrafae, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and urban landscapes in tropical and subtropical regions.
